segments.advisor_message: So, if we consider adding your daughter as a dependent on your taxes, it could actually provide you with some savings. I think it’s a good strategy.
segments.client_message: I dunno, it seems kinda complicated. I mean, is it really worth it to list her as a dependent? Like, how much would I actually save?

segments.advisor_message: Well, you would need to provide her full name and date of birth. This is standard when filing. It helps the IRS match the dependent to your tax return.
segments.client_message: Yeah, okay. I can do that, but I just feel like there’s gotta be some catch. My daughter was born on 15-04-2010, but like, will that even matter?

segments.advisor_message: Not at all! It’s important for tax reasons, especially regarding how long she’ll be considered your dependent.
segments.client_message: Right, but what if she turns 18 next year? Does that change anything? Like, I mean, how long can I still claim her?
